glsa.title: OpenSSL: Denial of service
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability in OpenSSL's handling of TLS handshakes could result in a Denial of Service condition.

background.p: OpenSSL is an Open Source toolkit implementing the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL v2/v3) and Transport Layer Security (TLS v1) as well as a general purpose cryptography library.

description.p: A flaw in the ssl3_take_mac function can result in a NULL pointer dereference.

impact.p: A remote attacker could send a specially crafted TLS handshake, resulting in a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All OpenSSL 1.0.1 users should upgrade to the latest version:
